intro: Villarsia crista-galli, commonly known as the crown-of-thorns, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, waxy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy appearance. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, and the plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
